result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Moses Sam Garcia

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:52 AM Defendant Moses Sam Garcia in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Moses Sam Garcia.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty Hayes wishes to waive time limits only.  State advises there was an officer available but advised that the officer was not needed to the his understanding of the time limit waiver.  Atty Hayes advises she believes there is a possible motion and needs to complete further investigation into that motion.  Atty Hayes advises time limits were not waived at the initial appearance.  Court will continue to waive time limits.  Matter reset for a TSC.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 04:00 pm.  DE confirms his address.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety if operating MV and must submit chemical testing by law enforcement.
Booking today, absolute sobriety if operating and must submit to chemical testing if requested by law enforcement.

1:21 PM Defendant Moses Sam Garcia in court.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE states he applied for a PD and did qualify but they couldn't be here today.  Time limits not waived for preliminary hearing.  22TR5128 and 22TR5129 to track.  $1,850.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today, absolute sobriety if operating and must submit to chemical testing if requested by law enforcement.
